channel.title: Profile Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Profile Model on OSCAL

item.title: Profile Model JSON Format Outline
item.description: + profile: [1]{… } - profile: [1]{ uuid: uuid [1], + metadata: [1]{… }, - metadata: [1]{ title: markup-line [1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [1], version: string [1], oscal-version: string [1], + revision-history: [0 to ∞]{… }, - revision-history: [0 to ∞]{ title: markup-line [0 or 1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], version: string [0 or 1],

item.title: Profile Model JSON Format Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_profile_schema.json Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-profile A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs, along with a series of operations over them. The topmost element in the OSCAL profile XML schema is profile. Switch to XML add Name Addition Description Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution This object appears as a property on: alter. The add object has the following members (properties):

item.title: OSCAL Profile Model XML Format Outline
item.description: + <profile uuid="uuid"> [1]… </profile> - <profile uuid="uuid"> [1] + <metadata> [1]… </metadata> - <metadata> [1] <title>markup-line</title> [1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [1] <version>string</version> [1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [1] + <revision-history>[0 or 1]… </revision-history> - <revision-history>[0 or 1] + <revision> [1 to ∞]… </revision> - <revision> [1 to ∞] <title>markup-line</title> [0 or 1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [0 or 1] <version>string</version> [0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [0 or 1]

item.title: OSCAL Profile Model XML Format Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_profile_schema.xsd Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-profile XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 A profile designates a selection and configuration of controls from one or more catalogs, along with a series of operations over them. The topmost element in the OSCAL profile XML schema is profile. Switch to JSON add Name Addition Description Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution This element appears inside: alter. The add element has the following contents (in order):
